articles.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Friday, November 9, 2018
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News" with Jeff Glor.

articles.author: Carter Evans
articles.title: Thousand Oaks survivor was friends with the shooter
articles.description: Todd Stratton said Ian Long might have suffered from PTSD
articles.content: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif. — Federal agents were back at 28-year-old Ian Long's house Friday, clearing the crime scene as they searched for clues as to why the former Marine opened fire in the Borderline Bar & Grill. Twelve people were killed with an extended … [+1030 chars]

articles.author: David Begnaud
articles.title: Deadly California wildfire causes "utter panic" as people try to escape
articles.description: "That fire from the second it started was off to the races," said Ken Pimlott, director of Cal Fire
articles.content: PARADISE, Calif. — Two wildfires have burned tens of thousands of acres since Thursday, and now mass evacuations are underway outside Los Angeles. That includes all of Malibu as the flames race toward the sea. As the fast-moving fire ravaged Northern Californ… [+1025 chars]

articles.title: High tea on "The Takeout" with Sir Kim Darroch 11/09/18
articles.description: Sir Kim Darroch, Britain's ambassador to the United States, joins Major Garrett for this week's edition of "The Takeout" to explain the special and deep relationship between the U.S. and the U.K.

articles.author: Paula Reid
articles.title: Trump denies knowing the man he appointed as the nation's top law enforcement official
articles.description: President Trump put some distance between himself and Matt Whitaker during an impromptu press conference
articles.content: WASHINGTON, D.C. -- During an impromptu press conference Friday before leaving for Paris, President Donald Trump put some distance between himself and Matt Whitaker, the newly appointed acting attorney general who now oversees special counsel Robert Mueller's… [+1107 chars]

articles.title: Was an Ivy League student slain in the name of hate?

articles.content: Produced by Jaime Stolz and Gayane Gayane Keshishyan Mendez "Not again." Yes again. "Not again." This week in Thousand Oaks, California, a madman's bullets left at least a dozen dead. In America this has become a devastating ritual. Two weeks ago it was Pitts… [+33414 chars]

articles.title: Diego Luna to star in "Star Wars" TV series
articles.description: He will reprise his role as Cassian Andor, the spy who helped Jyn Erso steal Death Star plans in "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story"
articles.content: Diego Luna is set to star in a new "Star Wars" TV series for Disney's upcoming streaming service, Disney+. He will reprise his role as Cassian Andor, the spy who helped Jyn Erso steal Death Star plans in "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story." The upcoming show will … [+1389 chars]

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.title: Wildfires tear through Northern, Southern California
articles.description: Tens of thousands of people have evacuated their homes as flames burn through communities in Butte, Ventura and Los Angeles Counties

articles.author: Grace Segers
articles.title: Rick Scott wins first election lawsuit
articles.description: Florida Gov. Rick Scott, the Republican candidate for Senate, has won his first lawsuit related to the election
articles.content: Florida Gov. Rick Scott, the Republican candidate for Senate who currently leads Democratic opponent Sen. Bill Nelson by 15,000 votes, has won his first lawsuit against Palm Beach County Elections Supervisor Susan Bucher. As ballots in the gubernatorial and S… [+1751 chars]

articles.author: Kate Smith
articles.title: Gun deaths on the rise after years of decline, CDC reports
articles.description: Gun-related deaths are on the rise in the U.S., bucking a decade-long decline, according to a new report from the CDC
articles.content: Gun-related deaths are on the rise in the U.S., bucking a decade-long decline, according to a new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. During 2015-2016, the federal agency says there were 27,394 homicides involving firearms and another … [+2110 chars]

articles.title: What Matthew Whitaker's appointment may mean for Mueller probe
articles.description: On the South Lawn of the White House Friday, President Trump made brief remarks about Matthew Whitaker, his new acting attorney general. What could his appointment mean for the Russia investigation? CBSN spoke with attorney Jesse Weber about the implications.

articles.title: Conjoined twins successfully separated in Australia
articles.description: Twin girls from Bhutan who were born connected from the chest to the pelvis have been separated in a six-hour operation at a hospital in Australia. Rachel Cary of Network 10 Australia reports.

articles.title: Michelle Obama opens up about infertility, miscarriage
articles.description: In an interview about her new memoir, former first lady Michelle Obama talks about her struggles with infertility and miscarriage.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Weighing yourself every day could help you lose more weight, study says
articles.description: Struggling to lose a few extra pounds? New research suggests this daily habit could help
articles.content: Struggling to lose those few extra pounds? New research suggests stepping on the scale every day could be the key to losing more weight. Sarah Lord is one of the many Americans trying to shed a few pounds. "I'll weigh myself on Monday morning to start my week… [+1669 chars]

articles.title: ACLU sues Trump administration over asylum changes
articles.description: The American Civil Liberties Union is suing the Trump administration after it laid out a regulation limiting asylum
articles.content: The American Civil Liberties Union is suing the Trump administration, after the president moved forward with a regulation that would withhold asylum protection from immigrants who cross the border illegally first on Thursday. The ACLU said in a post on Twitte… [+2364 chars]

articles.author: CBS Radio News, CBS Radio News
articles.title: WEEKEND ROUNDUP: 11/09
articles.description: The Democrats contol the house and the Republicans keep the reigns in the Senate after the 2018 midterm elections on Tuesday. President Trump holds an intense post-election news conference that ends in the controversial suspension of one reporter's press pass…

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Fortune Magazine sold to Thai businessman for $150 million
articles.description: Fortune will be bought by the Fortune Media Group, which is owned by Thai businessman Jiaravanon
articles.content: Media and publishing giant Meredith Corp. says it is selling its Fortune brand for $150 million in cash to Thai businessman Chatchaval Jiaravanon. The deal, subject to regulatory approval, is expected to close by the end of the year. Meredith said Friday it w… [+1303 chars]

articles.title: Recount possible in Florida governor and Senate races
articles.description: The races for governor and the Senate in Florida may be headed to a recount. Both Democratic candidates have closed the gap on their Republican opponents, and President Trump has responded by threatening to send in his own lawyers. CBS News political correspo…

articles.title: Arizona Senate race still too close to call
articles.description: The race for the Senate in Arizona is still too close to call. Republican Martha McSally initially led, but Democrat Kyrsten Sinema has since taken a slight lead. Jim Nintzel, the executive editor of the Tucson Weekly, joined CBSN to discuss what comes next.

articles.title: Camp Fire smoke blocks sunlight in Paradise, California
articles.description: A Northern California wildfire has exploded in size. The so-called Camp Fire partially destroyed the town of Paradise and has scorched more than 70,000 acres. CBS News correspondent David Begnaud joined CBSN from Paradise, where smoke from the fire has blocke…

articles.title: Atomwaffen is a "group that we should absolutely be concerned about"
articles.description: Joanna Mendelson of the Anti-Defamation League and Jake Hanrahan, a British journalist and "48 Hours consultant expose the secretive neo-Nazi hate group.

articles.author: Rachel Layne
articles.title: Why holiday shoppers might want to buy 2 of everything
articles.description: Retailers warn that price hikes are likely in the new year if higher U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports go into effect
articles.content: Some retailers have a holiday message for consumers: Buy now, or else face higher prices in January, when bigger tariffs on Chinese goods kick in. President Donald Trump imposed tariffs of 10 percent on $200 billion in imported Chinese goods on Sept. 24. Whil… [+4529 chars]

articles.title: Pipe bomb suspect indicted; faces possibility of life in prison
articles.description: Cesar Sayoc was accused of sending pipe bombs through the mail to prominent critics of President Donald Trump

articles.title: Stephen Hawking's thesis, wheelchair sell for much more than expected

articles.title: Utah resident dies of rabies, likely from a bat
articles.description: Health officials believe exposure to a bat was the source of the deadly infection
articles.content: A Utah resident has died from rabies, and health officials believe exposure to a bat was the source of infection. This is the first person in Utah to die from rabies since 1944, according to the state's health department. The person's name and other details w… [+4693 chars]

articles.title: REPORTERS NOTEBOOK: ALIEN CIVILIZATIONS
articles.description: Astronomers discovered an interstellar object last year that some scientists think may have been a probe sent by an alien civilization. CBS News Correspondent Allison Keyes takes a look on today's Reporter's Notebook.

articles.title: California officials give update on dangerous wildfires
articles.description: Wildfires in California have grown to thousands of acres are forcing widespread evacuations. At a briefing Friday, officials said people with evacuation orders need to "please get out."

articles.description: TV Guide editor Krutika Mallikarjuna joins CBSN to tell us the best shows to stream this weekend: "The Great British Baking Show," "Room 104," and "YOU."

articles.title: "48 Hours: In the Name of Hate" investigates student killed for being Jewish and gay
articles.description: This week's episode of "48 Hours" investigates the killing of Blake Bernstein, an Ivy League student who was allegedly murdered for being Jewish and gay. Correspondent Tracy Smith joined CBSN with details on the disturbing case out of California.

articles.title: Gary Vee and Tanya Ramos discuss 10th anniversary of “Pencils of Promise”
articles.description: Pencils of Promise CEO Tanya Ramos and entrepreneur Gary Vaynerchuk joined Dana Jacobson inside "CBS This Morning’s" Toyota Green Room to discuss the organization’s mission to build schools across the globe.

articles.description: After counting votes for more than 48 hours, some of the midterm election races are still not settled. Democrats and Republicans are still battling it out in Arizona and Florida. Ed O’Keefe reports.

articles.title: In Arizona and Florida, some key midterm races still undecided
articles.description: CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe joins CBSN with the latest on the ballot counts and the fights brewing between Democrats and Republicans in Florida and Arizona.

articles.title: Google and Amazon reportedly plan to expand in New York City
articles.description: New York City may become a bigger tech hub after reports that Google and Amazon are planning expansions there. Eric Gertler, executive chairman of U.S. News & World Report, joins CBSN to talk about what what the move may mean.

articles.description: Windy conditions fueling California's multiple wildfires could last into the weekend. CBS News weather producer David Parkinson joined CBSN with the latest forecast.

articles.title: Woolsey fire threatens thousands of homes in Southern California
articles.description: The Woolsey fire in Southern California has burned dozens of homes and threatens many more. CBS News John Blackstone joined CBSN from Oak Park, California, where firefighters worked throughout the night.

articles.description: 12 people were killed in the horrific Thousand Oaks bar shooting, including one man who'd survived last year's Las Vegas massacre and one police officer. CBS News' Vladimir Duthiers and Anne-Marie Green have more.

articles.title: Chris Christie being considered to replace Jeff Sessions as attorney general
articles.description: Now the Jeff Sessions has been forced out as attorney general, President Trump has turned his attention to who will replace him. The candidates include Chris Christie, Rudy Giuliani and Pam Bondi. CBS News Washington correspondent Paula Reid reports.

articles.title: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg hospitalized after fracturing 3 ribs
articles.description: Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was admitted to the hospital after she fractured three ribs during a fall. The 85-year-old has broken ribs before. CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford reports.

articles.title: Chris Christie being considered to replace Jeff Sessions as attorney general
articles.description: Now the Jeff Sessions has been forced out as attorney general, President Trump has turned his attention to who will replace him. The candidates include Chris Christie, Rudy Giuliani and Pam Bondi. CBS News Washington correspondent Paula Reid reports.

articles.title: Sergeant who responded to California shooting remembered as a hero
articles.description: One of the victims of the Thousand Oaks shooting is a sheriff's deputy who responded to the scene. During a procession Thursday, people lined up to pay their respects. CBS News correspondent Jamie Yuccas reports.

articles.title: Neighbor recalls hearing gunshot at home of California gunman
articles.description: Hours after a mass shooting at a California bar, FBI investigators raided the house where gunman Ian Long lived with his mother. Those who live nearby said he seemed to be frequently angry. CBS News correspondent John Blackstone reports.

articles.title: California's Camp Fire forces thousands to evacuate
articles.description: A fast-moving wildfire has prompted evacuations in Butte County, California. So far it's grown to almost 10,000 acres. CBS Sacramento's Rachel Wulff reports.
